content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here's a function `extract_julia_code` in Julia that extracts all the code blocks from a markdown document, removes code fences, and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline, returning a String:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md)
    parsed = Markdown.parse(md)
    code_blocks = filter(x -> isa(x, Markdown.Code) && x.language == "julia", parsed.content)
    code_str = join(map(x -> String(x.code), code_blocks), "\n\n")
    return code_str
end
```

This function uses the `Markdown` package from Julia's standard library to parse the markdown document. It then filters out all the `Markdown.Code` objects that have the language set to "julia". The `code` field of these objects is converted to a `String` and joined together with newline separators (`"\n\n"`). Finally, the joined code string is returned.

Note that this function assumes that the code blocks are correctly formatted with proper code fences (triple backticks) and the language identifier "julia". It does not handle any other types of code blocks or inline code snippets.
